pages.title: Care Outbreak Risk Assessment (Care OBRA) Tool for Acute Respiratory Infections

components.name: fIMmCL
components.content: Report Acute Respiratory Infections (ARI) in Adult Social Care e.g. COVID-19, Flu, RSV or unknown infection, including chest infections

components.name: nMOTrx
components.content:
This is an online Care Outbreak Risk Assessment (Care OBRA) Tool for all Adult Social Care providers to report:

  • NEW outbreaks of acute respiratory infections (ARI) e.g. COVID-19, Flu, RSV, chest infections or unknown respiratory infection OR
  • Single cases of Influenza (Flu)

The purpose of the Care OBRA Tool is to gather information that the UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA) Health Protection Team (HPT) or Community Infection Control Team (CICT) need to assess the situation within your setting, in order to help you manage the outbreak.

When to Report an Outbreak of Acute Respiratory Infection (ARI)

It is important to report an outbreak of ARI when there are indications of its potential spread within a care setting. An outbreak of ARI is defined as:

An ARI outbreak consists of 2 or more positive or clinically suspected linked cases of ARI, within the same setting with symptom onset dates within a 5-day period. Linkage between cases indicates that transmission may have occurred within the care setting. Linkage is much more likely if there are at least two resident cases.

Acute Respiratory symptoms include high temperature/fever or chills, sneezing, coryza (runny or blocked nose); muscle aches; sore throat, chesty cough, hoarseness, wheezing and chest infections.

How to Report an Outbreak of Acute Respiratory Infection

Fill in the questions in the Care OBRA Tool by clicking on the “Continue” button below. However, please make sure you read this page of instructions before beginning.

Completing the Care OBRA Tool

The questions in the Care OBRA Tool should take around 10 minutes to answer.

This form is for the reporting of NEW outbreaks of Acute Respiratory Infection (ARI) e.g. COVID-19, flu, RSV or unknown infection, including chest infections. It can also be used to report single cases of confirmed Influenza (flu).

It is NOT suitable for

  • updating on existing outbreaks/clusters that you have already notified to the HPT or CIC Team
  • single cases of COVID-19 (you no longer need to report these)
  • any other type of infection other than acute respiratory

Before You Start

You should try to test (using COVID-19 LFD test kits) all symptomatic service users and staff who are eligible for COVID-19 treatments.

However, do not delay reporting because of difficulties with testing.

Please be aware that if you leave the Care OBRA risk assessment tool part-way through, after 20 minutes of no activity, your answers will be reset and you will have to start again.

Therefore, we suggest you seek out the following information before you start to complete this form:

  • The postcode of your setting
  • Total number of Residents/Clients (service users) and Staff in your setting
  • Number of service users and/or Staff with symptoms (cases)
  • Dates of symptom onset for cases
  • Test results (and date of test) for anyone tested (please include test results for any ARI e.g. COVID, Flu, RSV)
  • Number of residents/clients and staff vaccinated, or not, for both COVID-19 and Influenza (Flu)

Please DO NOT include any person identifiable information about people receiving care in this form (e.g. names and date of births)

What happens next

As soon as you have answered the questions and “submitted” your data into the Care OBRA Tool, you will receive:

  • An automatic “Acknowledgement Email” stating whether you have reported a single case or a low-risk, medium-risk or high priority outbreak; The email will also contain a copy of the data that you have input into the Tool and a Care OBRA reference number [in the format OS_XXXX] and
  • A second automatic “Advice Email” which gives you information and advice on how to manage the situation that you have reported

For Low Risk COVID-19 outbreaks, all the advice you will need to manage your outbreak safely should be in the automated advice email.

For High Priority outbreaks, the HPT or the CICT (as per local arrangements) will look at the information that you have submitted and will always call you back (the same or next day, including weekends or bank holidays) to assess your outbreak further and/or give you further advice.

After submission of your data, if you receive an email that assesses your situation as “High Priority” over a weekend or a bank holiday, please also call the Health Protection Team (HPT) out of hours service, but please try and call during the daytime, if possible. If you don’t call the HPT, your outbreak will only be picked up by our team the next working day.

For Medium-Risk COVID-19 outbreaks, the HPT or the CICT (as per local arrangements) will look at the information that you have submitted on the next working day. They will use this information to decide whether, in addition to the advice given in the automated email, they feel that they or their partner organisations (e.g. local authority or NHS) can assist you further with your outbreak.

If you feel you have not received an appropriate response, then call your HPT or your CICT (as per local arrangements).

How to contact your UKHSA Health Protection Team (HPT)

Contact details for your local HPT (in and out of hours) can be found by clicking on this https://www.gov.uk/health-protection-team. If you are calling regarding a High Priority Outbreak at a weekend/bank holiday, you should tell the call handler that you have been directed to call this number by your local HPT and you should have your Care OBRA reference number to hand. The Care OBRA reference number will be in the format “OS_XXXX”.

If for any reason you have been unable to complete this form, or your enquiry is not suitable for entry onto this form (then please contact your local HPT the next working day if non-urgent, or in an emergency, call your HPT’s out of hours service (click on the link above to find details of your local HPT).

CQC Location ID

If you don’t know your CQC Location ID then please visit Using CQC data - Care Quality Commission and scroll about half-way down the page to CQC care directory - csv. You will find your CQC Location ID in this look up table.

Data sharing

The data you provide may be shared with other stakeholders such as your Local Authority, Community Infection Control Team and NHS in order to ensure you receive the most appropriate support from the most relevant organisation. The UKHSA data sharing policy can be found on:

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/ukhsa-privacy-notice

Continue for completion of the Care OBRA Tool

pages.title: Acute Respiratory Infections (ARI) - COVID-19, Flu or unknown infection in Adult Social Care settings

components.name: S0Q4
components.title: Please enter your setting Postcode
components.hint: Please provide the postcode of the specific setting affected (i.e. not the overarching management company if applicable). If there is no one specific setting affected e.g. Domiciliary or Home Care, then please provide the postcode of the care provider company

components.name: S0Q1
components.title: Please enter your Unique Organisation Number (UON)
components.hint: UON is an 8 digit number

components.name: S0Q2
components.title: Please enter your CQC Location ID

components.name: VMOkqi
components.content:
If you can't find your Unique Organisation Number (UON) then please visit Organisation number lookup - GOV.UK (test-for-coronavirus.service.gov.uk) (you will need your CQC Location ID).

If you don’t know your CQC Location ID then please visit Using CQC data - Care Quality Commission and scroll about half way down the page to CQC care directory - csv. You will find your CQC Location ID in this look up table.

components.name: S0Q3
components.title: Please enter your local HPT here
components.hint: Please make sure you've selected the correct local health protection team (HPT) to guarantee you receive the appropriate support

components.name: cstZQG
components.content: Click on the link to Find your local health protection team in England - GOV.UK (www.gov.uk) [Enter the postcode of your care setting]

pages.title: Section 1 - Details of your setting (Continuation 1)

components.name: S1Q4

components.hint: Please provide name of specific setting affected (i.e. not the overarching management company if applicable).

components.name: S1Q5
components.title: S1Q5. Name of Key Contact Person

components.name: S1Q6

components.hint: E.g. manager, senior carer.

components.name: S1Q7
components.title: S1Q7. Telephone number/s of Key Contact Person
components.hint: Please consider using a non-personal number.

components.name: S1Q8
components.title: S1Q8. Email of key contact person
components.hint: Please use an address that will be regularly and frequently monitored.

pages.title: Section 1 - Details of your setting (Continuation 2)

components.hint: If you are reporting an outbreak within a specific setting - please name that setting. Otherwise please state the name of the company providing the care e.g. the Domiciliary/Home Care agency.

components.name: S1Q5
components.title: S1Q5. Name of Key Contact Person

components.name: S1Q6

components.hint: E.g. manager, senior carer.

components.name: S1Q7

components.hint: Please consider using a non-personal number.

components.name: S1Q8

components.hint: Please use an address that will be regularly and frequently monitored.

components.name: sIFkPc
components.content: Please state what sort of setting you are.

components.name: S1Q3
components.title: S1Q3. Name of Care Provider/Company/Setting
components.hint: If you are reporting an outbreak within a specific setting - please name that setting. Otherwise please state the name of the company providing the care e.g. the Domiciliary/Home Care agency.

components.name: S1Q5
components.title: S1Q5. Name of Key Contact Person

pages.title: Section 3 - Details about the people receiving and giving care in your setting

components.name: KxkZJj
components.content: These questions ask for general information about the people you care for. Questions about staff and residents with symptoms of acute respiratory infection will be asked in later sections.

components.name: S3Q1
components.title: S3Q1. Thinking about the people you care for, please tick what best describes the MAJORITY of your clientele.
components.hint: You can select more than one option.

components.name: S3Q2
components.title: S3Q2. What is the total number of residents-clients who currently live in the home/use the service?
components.hint: Please include those who are currently in hospital or on visits out.

components.name: S3Q3
components.title: S3Q3. What is the total number of staff who currently work in your setting/service?

components.name: S3Q4
components.title: S3Q4. Number of Empty Beds
components.hint: If not a residential setting or you don't know, please select 0, otherwise please enter a number between 0 to 200.

pages.title: Section 4 - Details about current COVID-19 in your setting

components.name: SZtMfv
components.content: This section is about suspected or confirmed COVID-19 outbreaks and clusters. You will automatically move to the next section if you have no COVID-19 cases.

components.name: S4Q1
components.title: S4Q1. Have you had two or more cases(s) of COVID-19 in the last 5 days (either two confirmed by LFD OR one confirmed by LFD and one suspected case)?

components.name: fOmfbi
components.content: If you are currently changing your answer as part of the ‘Check your answers’ page, when you are re-directed back to the ‘Check your answers’ page, please ensure you have entered answers to all the mandatory questions that are newly visible on the page.

pages.title: Section 4 - Details about current COVID-19 in your setting (Continuation 1)

components.name: S4Q2
components.title: S4Q2. What is the total number of resident-client COVID-19 cases in the outbreak you are reporting (LFD confirmed only)?
components.hint:
Please include those with COVID-19 who are currently hospitalised or on visits out
</br>
If zero then please enter 0

components.name: S4Q3
components.title: S4Q3. What is the total number of staff COVID-19 cases in the outbreak you are reporting (LFD confirmed only)?
components.hint:
Please note that you are not required to test symptomatic staff for COVID-19
</br>
Please include those who are currently hospitalised with COVID-19
</br>
If zero then please enter 0.

components.name: S4Q4
components.title: S4Q4. What is the total number of residents-clients with COVID-19 symptoms who have not been tested?
components.hint:
Please include those with COVID-19 who are currently hospitalised or on visits out
</br>
If zero then please enter 0

components.name: S4Q5
components.title: S4Q5. What is the total number of staff with COVID-19 symptoms who have not been tested?
components.hint:
Please note that you are not required to test symptomatic staff for COVID-19
</br>
Please include those who are currently hospitalised with COVID-19
</br>
If zero then please enter 0

components.name: S4Q6
components.title: S4Q6. Symptom onset date of first case
components.hint: (DD/MM/YYYY)

components.name: S4Q7
components.title: S4Q7. Symptom onset date of second case
components.hint: (DD/MM/YYYY)

components.name: S4Q8
components.title: S4Q8. Symptom onset date of most recent case
components.hint: (DD/MM/YYYY)

components.name: S4Q9
components.title: S4Q9. For how many of your COVID-19 cases have you had to call the GP to review because of the severity of their illness?

components.name: S4Q10
components.title: S4Q10. During this outbreak, how many residents/clients or staff have been hospitalised due to COVID-19?

components.name: S4Q11
components.title: S4Q11. During this outbreak, how many residents/clients or staff have died due to COVID-19?

components.name: S4Q12
components.title: S4Q12. Are you aware of any media interest in this outbreak?

pages.title: Section 5 - Details about current Flu (Influenza) cases in your setting

components.name: sBtyXQ
components.content: This section is about influenza cases. You will automatically move to the next section if you answer NO to the first Question.

components.name: S5Q1
components.title: S5Q1. Are you reporting at least one case of confirmed Flu (Influenza)?

components.name: UZUwOk
components.content: If you are currently changing your answer as part of the ‘Check your answers’ page, when you are re-directed back to the ‘Check your answers’ page, please ensure you have entered answers to all the mandatory questions that are newly visible on the page.

pages.title: Section 5 - Details about current Flu (Influenza) cases in your setting (Continuation 1)

components.name: S5Q2
components.title: S5Q2. Among residents-clients, how many SWAB CONFIRMED Flu (Influenza) do you have currently?
components.hint:
Please count all cases either currently in your setting or in hospital.
</br>
If zero then please enter 0.

components.name: S5Q3
components.title: S5Q3. Among staff, how many SWAB CONFIRMED Flu (Influenza) do you have currently ?
components.hint:
Please count all cases either currently in your setting or in hospital.</br>
If zero then please enter 0.

components.name: S5Q4
components.title: S5Q4. Among residents-clients, how many cases do you have of suspected (not confirmed) Flu?
components.hint:
Suspected cases among elderly people may include people who have a sudden onset of acute respiratory symptoms OR Fever without other known cause OR sudden mental/physical deterioration without any other known cause. Please count all cases either currently in your setting or in hospital.</br>
If zero then please enter 0.

components.name: S5Q5
components.title: S5Q5. Among staff, how many cases do you have of suspected (not confirmed) Flu?
components.hint:
Suspected staff cases usually include people who have a sudden onset of acute respiratory symptoms AND Fever. Please count all cases either currently in your setting or in hospital.
Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S5Q6
components.title: S5Q6. Among residents-clients, EXCLUDING cases you have counted already in this section, how many have recently been diagnosed with a chest infection by a GP?
components.hint:
Please count all cases either currently in your setting or in hospital.
Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S5Q7
components.title: S5Q7. Among staff, EXCLUDING cases you have counted already in this section, how many have recently been diagnosed with a chest infection by a GP?
components.hint:
Please count all cases either currently at home or in hospital.
Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S5Q8
components.title: S5Q8. How many of these resident-client cases (confirmed flu, suspected flu or chest infections) have been tested for COVID-19?
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S5Q9
components.title: S5Q9. How many of these staff cases (confirmed flu, suspected flu or chest infections) have been tested for COVID-19?
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S5Q10
components.title: S5Q10. Of the residents-client tested for Covid-19, how many had a positive result?
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S5Q11
components.title: S5Q11. Of the staff tested for Covid-19, how many had a positive result?
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S5Q12
components.title: S5Q12. Symptom onset date of first case (confirmed flu, suspected flu OR chest infections)
components.hint: (DD/MM/YYYY)

components.name: S5Q13
components.title: S5Q13. Symptom onset date of second case (confirmed flu, suspected flu OR chest infections)
components.hint: (DD/MM/YYYY)

components.name: S5Q14
components.title: S5Q14. Symptom onset date of most recent case (confirmed flu, suspected flu OR chest infections)
components.hint: (DD/MM/YYYY)

components.name: S5Q15
components.title: S5Q15. For how many of your Flu (suspected flu, confirmed flu or chest infection) cases have you had to call the GP to review because of the severity of their illness?

components.name: S5Q16
components.title: S5Q16. During this outbreak, how many residents-clients or staff been hospitalised due to Flu (confirmed or suspected) or chest infection?

components.name: S5Q17
components.title: S5Q17. During this outbreak, how many cases have died due to Flu (confirmed or suspected) or chest infection?

components.name: S5Q18
components.title: S5Q18. Are the cases linked to a specific area of the setting or live/have worked across more than one area?

pages.title: Section 6 - Details about current Acute Respiratory Infections (ARIs) in your setting

components.name: rkWfvT
components.content: This section is about symptomatic cases of acute respiratory infection (ARI) where the causative organism/bug is not known. You will automatically move to the next section if you answer No.

components.name: S6Q1
components.title: S6Q1: Do you have two or more cases of ARI within your setting who have symptom onset dates within 5 days? This includes: ARI for which you do not know the infection/microorganism causing it OR you have had at least one person with a positive test for an ARI that isn't COVID-19 or Flu e.g. RSV parainfluenza, rhinovirus, human metapneumovirus etc and other/s with symptoms. If you have already entered these ARI cases in the COVID-19 or Flu section, do NOT re-enter them in this section and click "No" below
components.hint: For care homes only: If you haven't already, you should test the most recent five of your symptomatic residents/clients as soon as you can by COVID-19 LFD test.

components.name: DqLzcF
components.content: If you are currently changing your answer as part of the ‘Check your answers’ page, when you are re-directed back to the ‘Check your answers’ page, please ensure you have entered answers to all the mandatory questions that are newly visible on the page.

pages.title: Section 6 - Acute Respiratory Infection (Unknown) (Continuation 1)

components.name: S6Q2
components.title: S6Q2. What is the total number of Residents-Clients with this ARI in your setting (suspected or confirmed)?
components.hint: If zero then please enter 0.

components.name: S6Q3
components.title: S6Q3. What is the total number of Staff with this ARI in your setting (suspected or confirmed)?
components.hint: If zero then please enter 0.

components.name: S6Q4
components.title: S6Q4. Symptom onset date of first case
components.hint: (DD/MM/YYYY)

components.name: S6Q5
components.title: S6Q5. Symptom onset date of second case
components.hint: (DD/MM/YYYY)

components.name: S6Q6
components.title: S6Q6. Symptom onset date of most recent case
components.hint: (DD/MM/YYYY)

components.name: S6Q7
components.title: S6Q7. How many of these resident-client cases have been tested for COVID-19?
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S6Q8
components.title: S6Q8. How many of these staff cases have been tested for COVID-19?
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S6Q9
components.title: S6Q9. Of the residents-clients tested for Covid-19, how many had a positive result?
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S6Q10
components.title: S6Q10. Of the staff tested for Covid-19, how many had a positive result?
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S6Q11
components.title: S6Q11. How many of these resident-clients cases have been tested for Flu?
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S6Q12
components.title: S6Q12. How many of these staff cases have been tested for Flu?
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S6Q13
components.title: S6Q13. Of the residents-clients tested for Flu, how many had a positive result?
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S6Q14
components.title: S6Q14. Of the staff tested for Flu, how many had a positive result?
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S6Q15
components.title: S6Q15. For how many of your cases with this ARI have you had to call the GP to review because of the severity of their illness?

components.name: S6Q16
components.title: S6Q16. How many of all cases have been started on antibiotics for their respiratory symptoms?
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 50.

components.name: S6Q17
components.title: S6Q17. During this outbreak, how many cases been hospitalised due to this ARI?

components.name: S6Q18
components.title: S6Q18. During this outbreak, how many cases have died due to this ARI?

pages.title: Section 7 – Details about Vaccination among your staff and the people you care for

components.name: fIgqVh
components.content: The information you provide in this section will enable us to inform stakeholders about vaccination coverage in your setting.  They may then be able to assist you with improving uptake. Please complete this section with the actual numbers of residents-clients/staff having received flu or COVID-19 vaccination.

components.name: S7Q1
components.title: S7Q1. Number of Residents-Clients who are up to date with the current COVID-19 vaccination schedule
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 300.

components.name: S7Q2
components.title: S7Q2. Number of Staff who are up to date with the current COVID-19 vaccination schedule
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 300.

components.name: S7Q3
components.title: S7Q3. Number of Residents-Clients who have received a Flu vaccine for this current winter season
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 300.

components.name: S7Q4
components.title: S7Q4. Number of Staff who have received a Flu vaccine for this current winter season
components.hint: Please enter a number between 0 to 300.

pages.title: Section 8 - Infection Prevention and Control (IPC) Measures & Outbreak Management

components.name: S8Q1
components.title: S8Q1. How often are you monitoring staff Infection Prevention and Control practices e.g. hand hygiene and PPE compliance, environmental cleanliness?

components.name: S8Q2
components.title: S8Q2. What issues are you currently experiencing and require support on?
components.hint: You can select more than one option.

components.name: S8Q3
components.title: S8Q3. Does your setting undertake Aerosol Generating Procedures (AGPs)?
components.hint: E.g. tracheotomy/ostomy insertion or removal, non-invasive ventilation (NIV), bi-level positive Airway Pressure Ventilation (BiBPAP), Continuous Positive Airway Pressure Ventilation (CPAP), Induction of sputum using nebulised saline, respiratory tract suctioning (mouth suctioning is not an AGP).

components.name: YDTdPc
components.content: If you are currently changing your answer as part of the ‘Check your answers’ page, when you are re-directed back to the ‘Check your answers’ page, please ensure you have entered answers to all the mandatory questions that are newly visible on the page.

pages.title: Section 8 - Infection Prevention and Control (IPC) Measures & Outbreak Management (Continuation 1)

components.name: iMSWEB
components.content: This section will go over the (IPC) measures in your setting.

components.name: S8Q4
components.title: S8Q4. If AGPs undertaken, are staff fit-tested and wearing FFP3 masks?

pages.title: Section 9 - Staffing

components.name: zqNuGl
components.content: This section will go over the staffing in your setting.

components.name: S9Q1
components.title: S9Q1. Do you use agency staff or share staff with other care settings?

components.name: jfabXv
components.content: If you are currently changing your answer as part of the ‘Check your answers’ page, when you are re-directed back to the ‘Check your answers’ page, please ensure you have entered answers to all the mandatory questions that are newly visible on the page.

pages.title: Section 9 - Staffing (Continuation 1)

components.name: HBWjJk
components.content: This section will go over the staffing in your setting.

components.name: S9Q2
components.title: S9Q2. By how many have you had to increase your agency staff and/or how many more staff have you had to share across other care settings?

pages.title: Section 1 - Details of your setting

components.name: rHEHfX
components.content: These questions ask for basic information about your setting.

components.name: S1Q1
components.title: S1Q1. What type of adult social care provider are you?
components.hint: High risk supported living or extra care defined as closed community with substantial facilities shared between multiple people AND majority of residents(>50%) receive CQC regulated personal care.

components.name: S1Q2
components.title: S1Q2. If other, please state what sort of setting you are

components.name: KRUUTd
components.content: If you are currently changing your answer as part of the ‘Check your answers’ page, when you are re-directed back to the ‘Check your answers’ page, please ensure you have entered answers to all the mandatory questions that are newly visible on the page.

pages.title: Section 2 - What are you reporting?

components.name: PEfNTm
components.content: Are you reporting two or more cases of acute respiratory infection (Flu, COVID-19 or unidentified bug)?

components.name: S2Q1
components.title: S2Q1. Are you reporting two or more cases of acute respiratory infection (ARI)  within your setting who have symptom onset dates within 5 days and that are POTENTIALLY LINKED to transmission within your setting?  This includes  Flu, COVID-19, other respiratory viruses such as RSV, rhinovirus, parainfluenza etc, chest infections or acute respiratory infections for which you do not know the infection/microorganism causing it
components.hint: If you are unsure whether the cases may be linked due to transmission in your setting, please tick yes. If you are unsure about linkage, please see 'Acute Respiratory Infection supplement to the infection prevention and control resource for adult social care – GOV.UK (www.gov.uk)' section for guidance on whether cases can be considered as unlinked to transmission within the setting. Only click "No" if you are certain your cases are not linked to transmission within your setting.

components.name: azBXMt
components.content: If you are currently changing your answer as part of the ‘Check your answers’ page, when you are re-directed back to the ‘Check your answers’ page, please ensure you have entered answers to all the mandatory questions that are newly visible on the page.

pages.title: Section 2 - What are you reporting? (Continuation 1)

components.name: S2Q2
components.title: S2Q2. Are you reporting two or more cases of acute respiratory infection (ARI)  within your setting who have symptom onset dates within 5 days but they are DEFINTITELY NOT LINKED to transmission within your setting?  This includes  Flu, COVID-19, other respiratory viruses such as RSV, rhinovirus, parainfluenza etc, chest infections or acute respiratory infection for which you do not know the infection/microorganism causing it
components.hint: If you are unsure about linkage, please see 'Acute Respiratory Infection supplement to the infection prevention and control resource for adult social care – GOV.UK (www.gov.uk)' section for guidance on whether cases can be considered as unlinked to transmission within the setting. Only click "Yes" if you are certain your cases are not linked to transmission within your setting.

components.name: S2Q3
components.title: S2Q3. Are you reporting a single case of COVID-19 (or more than one case which are definitely unlinked)?

components.name: S2Q4

components.content: You must click "Yes" for at least one of the three previous questions (unlinked cases should be reported and managed as single cases).

pages.title: Check Your Answers

components.name: gxopvs
components.content: CONTENT

pages.title: Incomplete Risk Assessment Submission

components.name: IxNCHf
components.content:
Your Submission Could Not Be Completed

Thank you for your responses. However, based on your answers, a risk assessment cannot be created, and no risk rating or advice email can be sent out. This is because:

You answered Yes to S2Q1- indicating that you were: Reporting two or more cases of Acute Respiratory Infection (ARI) potentially linked to transmission within your setting. However, for subsequent questions you told us that you did not have cases of COVID, Influenza or other ARI.

Next Steps:

Review Your Responses: Please go back and review your answers to ensure they accurately reflect your current situation.

  • S2Q1- change your answer to No if you are reporting a single case or unlinked cases of (any) ARI (and you are not reporting 2 or more potentially linked ARI cases).
  • S4Q1- change your answer to Yes if you are reporting 2 or more potentially linked cases of COVID-19 (with at least one case confirmed by LFD testing).
  • S5Q1- change your answer to Yes- if are reporting least one confirmed influenza case.
  • S6Q1- change your answer to Yes – if you are reporting 2 or more cases of other ARI where you do not know the bug causing the infection (including if your concern is regarding residents diagnosed with chest infections) or the cause is known to be another ARI e.g., RSV.

Please contact your local health protection team at: https://www.gov.uk/health-protection-team or Community Infection Control Team (as per your usual arrangements) if:

  • You are still having difficulty reporting your Acute Respiratory Infection Outbreak.
  • You are trying to report a potential outbreak that is not ARI e.g., Diarrhoea and vomiting

components.content:
Your Submission Could Not Be Completed

Thank you for your responses. However, based on your answers, a risk assessment cannot be created, and no risk rating or advice email can be sent out. This is because:

You answered No to S2Q1- indicating that you were: Reporting one case of Acute Respiratory Infection (ARI) potentially linked to transmission within your setting. However, for subsequent questions you told us that you did not have cases of COVID, Influenza or other ARI.

Next Steps:

Review Your Responses: Please go back and review your answers to ensure they accurately reflect your current situation.

  • S2Q1- change your answer to Yes if you are reporting a single case or unlinked cases of (any) ARI (and you are not reporting 2 or more potentially linked ARI cases).
  • S4Q1- change your answer to Yes if you are reporting a single case of COVID-19 (or more than one case which are definitely unlinked).
  • S5Q1- change your answer to Yes- if you are reporting a single case of confirmed influenza (flu) in a staff member (or more than one case which are definitely unlinked).
  • S6Q1- change your answer to Yes – if you are Are you reporting a single case of confirmed influenza (flu) in a resident-client?

Please contact your local health protection team at: https://www.gov.uk/health-protection-team or Community Infection Control Team (as per your usual arrangements) if:

  • You are still having difficulty reporting your Acute Respiratory Infection Outbreak.
  • You are trying to report a potential outbreak that is not ARI e.g., Diarrhoea and vomiting

field.name: S5Q1
field.display: S5Q1. Are you reporting at least one case of confirmed Flu (Influenza)?

field.name: S2Q1
field.display: S2Q1. Are you reporting two or more cases of acute respiratory infection (ARI)  within your setting who have symptom onset dates within 5 days and that are POTENTIALLY LINKED to transmission within your setting?  This includes  Flu, COVID-19, other respiratory viruses such as RSV, rhinovirus, parainfluenza etc, chest infections or acute respiratory infections for which you do not know the infection/microorganism causing it

field.name: S4Q1
field.display: S4Q1. Have you had two or more cases(s) of COVID-19 in the last 5 days (either two confirmed by LFD OR one confirmed by LFD and one suspected case)?

field.name: S5Q1
field.display: S5Q1. Are you reporting at least one case of confirmed Flu (Influenza)?

field.name: S6Q1
field.display: S6Q1: Do you have two or more cases of ARI within your setting who have symptom onset dates within 5 days? This includes: ARI for which you do not know the infection/microorganism causing it OR you have had at least one person with a positive test for an ARI that isn't COVID-19 or Flu e.g. RSV parainfluenza, rhinovirus, human metapneumovirus etc and other/s with symptoms. If you have already entered these ARI cases in the COVID-19 or Flu section, do NOT re-enter them in this section and click "No" below

field.name: S2Q1
field.display: S2Q1. Are you reporting two or more cases of acute respiratory infection (ARI)  within your setting who have symptom onset dates within 5 days and that are POTENTIALLY LINKED to transmission within your setting?  This includes  Flu, COVID-19, other respiratory viruses such as RSV, rhinovirus, parainfluenza etc, chest infections or acute respiratory infections for which you do not know the infection/microorganism causing it

field.name: S2Q2
field.display: S2Q2. Are you reporting two or more cases of acute respiratory infection (ARI)  within your setting who have symptom onset dates within 5 days but they are DEFINTITELY NOT LINKED to transmission within your setting?  This includes  Flu, COVID-19, other respiratory viruses such as RSV, rhinovirus, parainfluenza etc, chest infections or acute respiratory infection for which you do not know the infection/microorganism causing it

declaration:
In this section you can review and change your answers. The Submit button at the bottom of this page will result in your responses being submitted.
Please be aware that your responses in this form may be shared with the Local Authority, Community Infection Control Team, Health Protection Team and/or NHS for the purposes of assisting you with the management of your situation.

Once you press “submit”, you should receive at least two automatic emails from the Care OBRA Tool:

  • One “acknowledgement email” which gives a summary of the information you entered onto the form
  • One “advice email” which tells you what steps you should take to prevent spread of infection amongst your clients/residents and staff; and what to expect next from your Health Protection Team (HPT) or Community Infection Control (CIC) Team
  • If you have reported an outbreak AND a single case of a different infection, you may receive an additional advice email

If:

  • You do not receive these emails within one hour OR
  • You need very urgent outbreak management advice

You should call your local HPT or CIC Team.

If you do not know the contact details of your HPT you can find them here - Find your local health protection team in England - GOV.UK (www.gov.uk)

Before submitting your answers, please ensure you have not included any person identifiable information in your responses (e.g. names or dates of birth).

Please tick to confirm understanding of this.
name: Report an outbreak
